original: yaṁ sīlavā bhavissati, pātimokkhasaṁvarasaṁvuto viharissati, ācāragocarasampanno,🔽aṇumattesu vajjesu bhayadassāvī, samādāya sikkhissati sikkhāpadesu.
analyzed: yam sīlavā bhavissati pātimokkha savara savutaḥ viharissati ācāra gocara sampannaḥ  aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya dassāvī samādāya sikkhissati sikkhāpadesu
translated: He will be one who resorts to remote lodgings in forests and jungle groves.

original: Kalyāṇamittassetaṁ, meghiya, bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkhaṁ kalyāṇasahāyassa kalyāṇasampavaṅkassa🔽yaṁ yāyaṁ kathā abhisallekhikā cetovivaraṇasappāyā ekantanibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya
analyzed: kalyāṇa mittassa ita meghiya bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkham kalyāṇa sahāyassa kalyāṇa sampavaṅkassa  yam yā ayam kathā abhisallekhikā cetaḥ vivaraṇa sappāyai ekanta nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya
translated: “Meghiya, it is to be expected that a bhikkhu who has a good friend, a good companion, a good comrade will have learned much, will remember what he has learned, and will accumulate what he has learned.

original: upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya saṁvattati, seyyathidaṁ—appicchakathā, santuṭṭhikathā,
analyzed: upasamāya abhiññāya sambodhāya nibbānāya savattati sā iyyathida appiccha kathā santuṭṭhi kathā
translated: Those teachings that are good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with the right meaning and phrasing, which proclaim the perfectly complete and pure spiritual life—such teachings as these he will have learned much of, remember, master, and examine with his mind, and then penetrate them well by view.🔽“Meghiya, it is to be expected that a bhikkhu who has a good friend, a good companion, a good comrade will be one who associates with good friends, associates with good companions, and associates with good comrades.

original: pavivekakathā, asaṁsaggakathā, vīriyārambhakathā, sīlakathā, samādhikathā, paññākathā,
analyzed: pa viveka kathā a saṃsagga kathā vīriya ārambha kathā sīla kathā samādhi kathā paññā kathā
translated: “Meghiya, it is to be expected that a bhikkhu who has a good friend, a good companion, a good comrade will be one who resorts to remote lodgings in forests and jungle groves.

original: vimuttikathā, vimuttiñāṇadassanakathā; evarūpāya kathāya nikāmalābhī bhavissati akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.
analyzed: vimutti kathā vimutti ñāṇa dassana kathā evarūpāya kathāya nikāma lābhī bhavissati akiccha lābhī akasira lābhī
translated: He will find at will, without trouble or difficulty, companions in the holy life to be companions with,🔽for one who has good friends, good companions, good comrades.

original: Kalyāṇamittassetaṁ, meghiya, bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkhaṁ kalyāṇasahāyassa kalyāṇasampavaṅkassa
analyzed: kalyāṇa mittassa ita meghiya bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkham kalyāṇa sahāyassa kalyāṇa sampavaṅkassa
translated: He will be one who initiates, instigates, and arranges for wholesome virtuous behavior,🔽and who, having undertaken wholesome virtuous behavior, finds satisfaction in it.🔽He will be one who initiates, instigates, and arranges for energy,

original: yaṁ āraddhavīriyo viharissati akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānāya, kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ🔽upasampadāya, thāmavā daḷhaparakkamo anikkhittadhuro kusalesu dhammesu.🔽Kalyāṇamittassetaṁ, meghiya, bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkhaṁ kalyāṇasahāyassa kalyāṇasampavaṅkassa
analyzed: yam āraddha vīriyaḥ viharissati akusalānam dhammānam pahānāya kusalānam dhammānam  upasampadāya thāmavā daḷha parakkamaḥ a nikkhitta dhuraḥ kusalesu dhammesu  kalyāṇa mittassa ita meghiya bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkham kalyāṇa sahāyassa kalyāṇa sampavaṅkassa
translated: and who, having aroused energy, finds satisfaction in it.🔽He will be one who initiates, instigates, and arranges for wisdom,

original: yaṁ paññavā bhavissati, udayatthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya🔽sammā dukkhakkhayagāminiyā.

translated: and who, having developed wisdom, finds satisfaction in it.

original: Tena ca pana, meghiya, bhikkhunā imesu pañcasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya cattāro dhammā uttari bhāvetabbā—
analyzed: tena ca pana meghiya bhikkhunā imesu pañcasu dhammesu patiṭṭhāya cattāro dhammā uttari bhāvetabbā
translated: “Meghiya, a bhikkhu who is accomplished in these five things and who has developed these four things should further develop six things that partake of true knowledge.

original: asubhā bhāvetabbā rāgassa pahānāya, mettā bhāvetabbā byāpādassa pahānāya, ānāpānassati bhāvetabbā vitakkupacchedāya, aniccasaññā bhāvetabbā asmimānasamugghātāya.
analyzed: asubhā bhāvetabbā rāgassa pahānāya mettā bhāvetabbā byāpādassa pahānāya āna apāna sati bhāvetabbā vitakka upacchedāya anicca saññā bhāvetabbā asmimāna samugghātāya
translated: foulness should be developed for the abandoning of lust, loving-kindness should be developed for the abandoning of ill will, mindfulness of in-and-out breathing should be developed for the cutting off of thoughts, the perception of impermanence should be developed for the uprooting of the conceit ‘I am.’

original: Aniccasaññino hi, meghiya, anattasaññā saṇṭhāti,
analyzed: anicca saññinaḥ hi meghiya anatta saññā saṇṭhāti
translated: For one who perceives permanence, Meghiya, the perception of non-self becomes steady.

original: anattasaññī asmimānasamugghātaṁ pāpuṇāti diṭṭheva dhamme nibbānan”ti.
analyzed: anatta saññī pāpuṇāti diṭṭhe iva dhamme nibbānam ti
translated: One who perceives non-self, Meghiya, attains the uprooting of the conceit ‘I am,’ attains final Nibbāna in this very life.”
